page.title: 12 A School In Blackheath
page.content: John Ball supplies Blackheath village with a state primary school. The school was opened in 1953. It has a junior department of 225 children aged between 7 and 11,an infant department of 170 children aged 5 to 7 and a newly built off-site nursery where children from 3 can attend half day sessions.The school is run by a head teacher,20 assistant teachers & a number of ancillary staff. The curriculum is based upon learning by experience.The infant department emphasises reading,writing, & practical number work.The juniors participate in a variety fo activities both in & out of school including football,netball, chess,drama & cricket. The children leave at 11 to go to a variety of secondary schools.
